mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McClenahan, John
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Feels that Mitchel does not support the [IAEA] organization and that Tyler should attempt to persuade him into its favor; speaks pejoratively regarding editor of the Irish-American, Lynch; claims that the Massachusetts Convention was "a sorry affair"; recommends Lumsden to strengthen the organization; Harris wanted to know who informed McClenahan that he was a British spy, but McClenahan would not tell him. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1856 January 5, John McClenahan, New York, N.Y. to Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
